justification: The paper uses the Delay Discounting (DD) task model to assess how individuals prefer small immediate rewards to larger delayed rewards, focusing on the discounting rate as a measure of impulsivity.
The Cumulative Prospect Theory model is utilized to measure the extent of ambiguity aversion and subjective probability by analyzing choices between known and uncertain probabilities.

measured_by: ADO-D (Adaptive Design Optimization based on D-optimality)
justification: The ADO-D method is employed to improve the estimation precision of group-level cognitive decision-making parameters in various models like DD and CPT through adaptive stimulus selection.
Hierarchical Bayesian estimation is applied to analyze the entire dataset, estimating both group-level and individual-level parameters to interpret experimental manipulation effects.
